description:
Reform U.K. has overtaken the Tories among over-55s, a new poll shows, as former Minister Nadine Dorries says the Conservative Party will "probably disappear" at the General Election.

The post Reform Overtakes Tories Among Over-55s appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Reform Overtakes Tories Among Over-55s

description:
Historian David Olusoga can often be heard complaining about the British Empire and its supposedly malign legacy. But in truth the 'British Empire' is not something that every really existed, says Prof James Alexander.

The post Did ‘The British Empire’ Ever Actually Exist? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Did ‘The British Empire’ Ever Actually Exist?

description:
Back in March, the Government announced new rules to put an end to 'debanking'. But it seems the Conservatives never got round to actually bringing them into force – and now the election has killed them off.

The post Tories Fail to Bring in Debanking Rules Before Election appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Tories Fail to Bring in Debanking Rules Before Election

description:
With the Hay Book Festival boycott of Baillie Gifford, the EDI revolution is eating its own, says C.J. Strachan. The fund manager sponsor is as woke as they come but that didn't spare it – and companies are taking note.

The post The EDI Revolution is Eating its Own and Companies Have Noticed appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: The EDI Revolution is Eating its Own and Companies Have Noticed

description:
Elon Musk has said "freedom of speech is worth fighting for" after Australia's cyber safety regulator dropped its federal court case over X Corp's refusal to globally block footage it deemed harmful.

The post “Free Speech Prevailed” Says Elon Musk as Australia Drops Bid to Censor Internet Globally appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: “Free Speech Prevailed” Says Elon Musk as Australia Drops Bid to Censor Internet Globally

description:
The Met Office claims that May – which everyone knows was damp and chilly – was the “warmest on record”. What kind of junk statistics produce this blatant gaslighting? asks Ben Pile.

The post The Met Office is Gaslighting Us With its Claim that Our Damp and Chilly May Was “Warmest on Record” appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: The Met Office is Gaslighting Us With its Claim that Our Damp and Chilly May Was “Warmest on Record”

description:
In the first episode of the Sceptic, the Daily Sceptic's brand new weekly podcast, Laurie Wastell interviews Chris Morrison, Kathrine Jebsen Moore and David McGrogan.

The post The Daily Sceptic’s Brand New Weekly Podcast appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: The Daily Sceptic’s Brand New Weekly Podcast

description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up
